meanings.definition: The quality of having unlimited power or authority.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the king's omnipotence allowed him to control the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in the omnipotence of a higher being.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought of himself as the ruler of the house, his omnipotence evident in the way he demanded treats.
meanings.sent4: Her omnipotence in the company made her the go-to person for solving any problem.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's omnipotence made him invincible against any enemy.

meanings.definition: The ability to do anything or everything.
meanings.sent1: With his omnipotence, the magician could make anything disappear with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent2: The genie's omnipotence allowed him to grant any wish that was asked of him.
meanings.sent3: The toddler believed in his omnipotence, thinking he could make the sun rise and set at his command.
meanings.sent4: The artist's omnipotence over his craft was evident in the intricate details of his masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The computer's omnipotence in processing data quickly impressed the researchers.
